org.mocksy.filter
Interface ResponseFilter

All Known Implementing Classes:
PropertyFilter, XslFilter
public interface ResponseFilter

ResponseFilters allow you to augment the response data that is produced from a Request. The interface is flexible enough to allow to do to just about anything, but the intent is that ResponseFilters are used to add a dynamic nature to the otherwise static Responses, or to transform shared Responses for a particular scenario.

Author:
Saleem Shafi

Method Summary
 InputStream filter(InputStream input)
          Applies the filtering logic to the InputStream and returns a filtered InputStream.
 Map<String,String> getProperties()
          Returns the properties used to process this filter.
 void initialize(Map<String,String> properties)
          Initialization method that accepts a generic Map of String pairs to provide any settings/parameters that might be needed to make the filter work properly.
 void setRelativeSource(Source source)
          Allows the code that is configuring the filter to define a relative Source object so that if the ResponseFilter needs to find resources for its filtering, it can do so relative to this Source object.
 

Method Detail

filter

InputStream filter(InputStream input)
                   throws FilterException
Applies the filtering logic to the InputStream and returns a filtered InputStream. Because the input and output types are the same, it is possible to chain multiple ResponseFilters together.

Parameters:
input - unfiltered InputStream
Returns:
filtered InputStream
Throws:
FilterException - if there's any error in applying the filter

initialize

void initialize(Map<String,String> properties)
                throws FilterException
Initialization method that accepts a generic Map of String pairs to provide any settings/parameters that might be needed to make the filter work properly.

Parameters:
properties - Map of properties to be used to configure the filter
Throws:
FilterException - if there's a problem with any of the properties

setRelativeSource

void setRelativeSource(Source source)
Allows the code that is configuring the filter to define a relative Source object so that if the ResponseFilter needs to find resources for its filtering, it can do so relative to this Source object.

Parameters:
source - the Source object to treat as the relative location for any needed resources.

getProperties

Map<String,String> getProperties()
Returns the properties used to process this filter. This will usually be the same as the ones passed into the initialize(Map) method, however, the ResponseFilter implementation might want to modify these.

Returns:
the properties used by this filter
